alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Delaware; Iowa; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Jo Daviess, Jackson, Cedar, northwestern Scott, southern Dubuque, northern Johnson, Jones, southeastern Delaware, southeastern Linn, northwestern Clinton and east central Iowa Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 315 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Worthington to Oxford. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cascade and Worthington around 320 AM CDT. Shueyville around 325 AM CDT. Bernard and Lake Macbride State Park around 335 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Solon, Zwingle, La Motte, St. Donatus, Tipton and Stanwood. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 2 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cedar; Clinton; Delaware; Iowa; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn
